cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 265 miles ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW then turning NW, expected to pass just north-east of the Leeward Islands and remain over the Atlantic east of Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Northern Leeward Islands (close pass near Barbuda/Saint-Maarten – no direct Puerto Rico landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches for Puerto Rico. Current watches confined to British Virgin Islands, St. Thomas & St. John.
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – hurricane warnings limited to Barbuda, Anguilla, Sint Maarten/St. Martin, St. Barthelemy.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands from Guadeloupe northward to Anguilla; US/British Virgin Islands exposed to outer wind field.
weather_observation.wind: 10–15% chance of sustained 34-kt winds (tropical-storm force) Saturday evening through early Sunday; hurricane-force winds not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along San Juan coast – surge confined to islands nearer the core.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rainfall possible, locally up to 3 inches; flooding threat low.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells, rough surf, and dangerous rip currents beginning Saturday.
